channel.title: Close to death Idea
channel.description:
I have a suggestion for a near death idea. Once your health gets to lower than 20%, you start hearing your heart beating. After 10%, Gordon goes into panic mode, which then your weapons seem more powerful and accuracy is greatly increased in fear of death, which would probably happen in real-life. Things would seem slower at 5% and for a death idea, Gordons life could flash before his eyes quickly before you die.
Just a thought :stuck_out_tongue:

item.title: Close to death Idea
item.dc:creator: Melon
item.description:
I like the idea of hearing him pant now and then when he’s wounded, but that’s about it, I don’t want the damage-/speed system to change if I’m low on health. It would be like the equalizer from Team Fortress 2.

Read full topic

item.title: Close to death Idea
item.dc:creator: BaTz281
item.description:
In fact, do they even issue helmet’s with heads up displays that give you real time status reports on your armour, health, ammo, inventory, and location of enemies relative to your postion? That’d be sweet, lol.

They do have technology that reports, or will have the capability of reporting: armor integrity, ammunition spent, location of enemies relative to your position, location of friendly units, temperature, environmental hazards, etc.

https://www.popsci.com/bown/2009/product/ears-gunshot-localization-system

As for health, well, that’s a relative definition

Read full topic

item.title: Close to death Idea
item.dc:creator: DansonDelta40
item.description:
Don’t tell me you thought that being close to dying suddenly makes you a much better fighter?

That’s what usually happens “in the moviez!” So maybe that’s where the idea comes from.

Read full topic

item.title: Close to death Idea
item.dc:creator: baconeggs
item.description:
Redhotpengy:

LOL Looks like I’m wrong! Thanks for teaching me that though!

Don’t tell me you thought that being close to dying suddenly makes you a much better fighter?

taxi_evil:

They do indeed, or at least such a thing exists. Last I heard it had a delay between the information being sent and being displayed, so was of limited use, but that was a year or two ago, so could be more effective now

Maybe you’re thinking of the HUD system that links an aimer on the soldier’s weapon with a corresponding crosshair, because last time I checked it’s pretty hard to accurately measure “health” and put it in simple format.

Read full topic

In fact, do they even issue helmet’s with heads up displays that give you real time status reports on your armour, health, ammo, inventory, and location of enemies relative to your postion? That’d be sweet, lol.

They do indeed, or at least such a thing exists. Last I heard it had a delay between the information being sent and being displayed, so was of limited use, but that was a year or two ago, so could be more effective now

item.title: Close to death Idea
item.dc:creator: UrBY
item.description:
Brother Shrike:

Half-Life’s immersion is so good as-is that I often find myself ducking from enemy fire, leaning to avoid grenades, etc. As stupid as that sounds :rolleyes:

Yeah, that sounds stupid.

That’s most likely why I do it too.

Read full topic

item.title: Close to death Idea
item.dc:creator: Redhotpengy
item.description:
The Javid:

Actually when you panic your accuracy decreases, this is because your muscle twiching is increased and your shots tend to be hurried. Also the lower your health gets the less you are capable of fighting. Things seem to happen faster than they are and your body has trouble keeping up since it’s trying to heal itself.
Your idea makes as much sense as being able to sprint faster with broken legs.

LOL Looks like I’m wrong! Thanks for teaching me that though!

Read full topic

item.title: Close to death Idea
item.dc:creator: darkone
item.description:
Grey Acumen:

“We’ll need o run a few blood tests to make sure you’re okay… hrmm… odd… blood is usually red… most unusual…”

“well Gordon, your results came back. You apparently don’t have any of your own blood left. What I extracted from you earlier was apparently pure morphine.”

i can see that being true 50% of the way through the game.

Read full topic

item.title: Close to death Idea
item.dc:creator: baconeggs
item.description:
Wolfguard:

I think it’s a good suggestion. If done right and properly, and with the capabilities of the HEV suit in mind, it could add to the immersion and atmosphere of the game.

No. This goes against Valve’s philosophy of minimal character awareness to create immersion. YOU are Gordon. If you want to simulate this then start walking instead of running when your health is low, or crouch and look at the ground when you take a bad hit. Me being the hardcore roleplayer that I am I’ll usually stop moving and hide behind cover for a few seconds after taking a grenade hit, even though I can still move normally gameplay-wise.

Read full topic
